oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Air shots of the Capitol Hill, Nashville, Tennessee, 1957 July 01
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The Tennessee State Capitol Building and redevelopment area is pictured in this July 1st, 1957 aerial of Capitol Hill in downtown Nashville. This is related to the Capitol Hill Redevelopment Project, a major urban renewal project implemented in the 1950s. The Tennessee State Capitol was designed by architect William Strickland, who modeled it after a Greek Ionic temple. The cornerstone was laid on July 4th, 1845 and the building was completed fourteen years later in 1859. Forms part of Record Group 412, Photographs Collection. 1 photograph negative : b & w ; 4 x 5 in.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Tennessee State Capitol (Nashville, Tenn.)
